context: The Finnish word 'kuukausi' means 'month' in English. It is a noun referring to a period of approximately 30 days that forms part of the calendar year. The word can be declined in different cases (like genitive singular 'kuukaudesta', partitive plural 'kuukausia') and has related forms such as 'kuukausittain' meaning 'monthly'. It is commonly used to refer to specific months or periods within a year.
